playerOptions.question: It's time to launch the game! You have a few options to do that:

options.resultGood: Only canadians are playing your game, but you managed to fix a few bugs before international release!
options.resultBad: You game is being played by chinese bots, and your mechanic is already being copied

options.resultGood: Microsoft loved your game and decided to invest money on it!
options.resultBad: Who the hell has a windows phone Mr. PO?

options.resultGood: A celebrity played your game and tweeted about it! Revenue is incresing fast worldwide!
options.resultBad: You just discovered that your game has debug texts like Your mom'. WORLDWIDE.

playerOptions.question: Oops, Your Game Designer, suddenly left work to go get a tatoo! What do you want to do?

options.resultGood: Oops arrives just in time to help the team with the new features and the Sprint is a success!
options.resultBad: The team had nobody to ask how the new features should work and, somehow, your Cooking Game is now a War FPS.

options.resultGood: The whole team now has awesome tatoos! Everyone gets fired up by it and finishes the Sprint in half the time!
options.resultBad: The team can't shut up about how they wanna make a Tatoo Game next time.

options.resultGood: Oops yells 'Se me atacar, eu vou atacar!', yet, decides to attack first. You fall on your back and raise your feet in the air. Oops sould have some trouble sitting for about a week, but your PO pride is intact.
options.resultBad: The last words you got to hear were 'Se me atacar, eu vou atacar!'. By the time you're awake, you've already become a Slack emoji.

playerOptions.question: The new Engine update has broken all of the games! What do we do?

options.resultGood: The devs decided to wait before doing the fixes and started working on features as if the error hadn't hapened. Engine issued a fix later that solved the problems.
options.resultBad: The devs fixed the problems with lots of workarounds. The problem is that Engine issued a fix shrotly afterwards. Now they've gotta undo the workarounds.

options.resultGood: It took a lot of work, but Pizza triumphed against Engine. The studio bought pizza for everyone.
options.resultBad: Rose says she last saw Pizza repeating 'T-ERROR! Nothing can fix the T-ERROR!' over and over. Pizza hasn't been seen since. Later that week Engine fixed the problem.

options.resultGood: The transition to Unity went smoothly and you're now big Unity partners! Engine was fixed later, so half of the teams went back to Engine.
options.resultBad: There were some problems and Engine issued a fix a week later, so everyone just went back to Engine.

playerOptions.question: You have received an e-mail from an angry player that says your App notifications have traumatized their family.

options.resultGood: Fortunately, nothing bad happened. The tale of the Fox, the Boo and the Ghost soon becomes a legend told from the seniors to the juniors.
options.resultBad: The customer cannot live with the trauma and commits suicide. It doesn't generate bad publicity but it gives you trouble sleeping at night.

options.resultGood: You send a heartwarming apology and a free HC pack. The internet notices your act of kindness and the company gets free publicity.
options.resultBad: You send a mild apology that isn't good enough for their trouble. Oh well.

options.resultGood: Your answer quickly grows into an internet Meme, driving further publicity to your game studio.
options.resultBad: You get sued big. What, did you think making fun of a customer was a good idea?
